Job Title: Electrical Engineer- (Rotating Machine Design)

Location: Cheswick, PA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Design, Engineering, Project Management

Description:
Summary

Our client is looking for an Electrical Engineer (Rotating Machine Design) to join their Pittsburgh (Cheswick) location. The Electrical Engineer will design and analyze moderately complex electro-mechanical components and systems, for our power manufacturing facility, EMD (Electrical-Mechanical Division). In addition, you will develop design information for use in reports, specifications, and drawings as well as direct support personal in product design, fabrication, and testing.

Salary: $110,000-$120,000 base salary (flexible/based on experience) Full Benefits Sign on bonus Relocation package provided for candidates not in the area

Location: Cheswick, PA 15024

Work Schedule: Core Engineer hours are 9am-3pm, there is flexibility also per role/manager 1-2 days at home or 9/80--- examples (7-3:30. 8-4:30, 9-5)

Responsibilities: Provides engineering design, maintenance support and training for new product and equipment. Assess new and existing equipment to optimize design efficiency, safety, quality, and cost effectiveness. Designs and conducts experiments, collects data, and interprets results; conducts analysis and writes analysis and test reports. Capable of drawing conclusions and reconciling differences between predicted values and actual results. Plans, coordinates, and executes, with guidance, a variety of engineering activities including documentation, reporting, publishing, and making technical or other presentations. Designs new equipment and machinery. Capable of leading engineering teams through moderately complex technical issues. Actively supports development of engineering planning for development of new designs and redesign efforts. Determines technical objectives and develops innovative, practical solutions to advance technical engineering problems. Provides technical support to failure investigations and bid responses. Performs engineering assignments in a timely manner under minimal guidance of a more senior engineer. Develop useful understanding and apply engineering software tools and systems (e.g., AA102, Ansys, MATLAB, MATHCAD, Flux2D, etc.) as necessary to complete assignments.

Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree 7+ years’ experience Must have core FEA experience, and a background working on motors, pumps, or generations. Must have industry exposure. 2D/3D Electro Magnetic Finite Element Analysis, System Modeling (Mathcad, Matlab, Flux2D), Thermal Analysis Must be sole US citizen and be able to obtain and maintain DOD security clearance

About the Company: Global leader in aerospace, defense, and power solutions, with a 60+ year history of collaboration with the U.S. government.

Join us in Cheswick to impact critical equipment and advance aerospace and defense solutions. Apply now.

Experience Level (if available): Associate
